DIGM 100.courseDesc: Students learn the basics of visual design within the digital realm. Software tools such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator are utilized.
DIGM 100.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 105.courseDesc: Surveys the history, theory, practice, technologies, and related social issues associated with the growth of digital media.
DIGM 105.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 131.fullName: Introduction to Scripting for the Digital Content Creation Pipeline
DIGM 131.courseDesc: This course introduces fundamental scripting concepts through the exploration of modern scripting languages commonly used in disciplines related to digital content creation (DCC) pipelines.
DIGM 131.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 250.courseDesc: Provides a professional orientation to the field through an exploration of a variety of digital media projects. In addition to lecture and discussions, allows students to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of digital media production from proposals to product delivery.
DIGM 250.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 308.courseDesc: Digital Cultural Heritage is a growing pursuit including Digital Media, Digital Humanities, Computer Science, and Archeology. It has components in academic research, museology, tourism, economic development as well as new media technology development and applications. This class will investigate this emerging and exciting field and explore its possibilities in the context of Philadelphia’s cultural heritage.
DIGM 308.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 350.courseDesc: By surfing the internet and playing computer games, by lectures, assigned readings, class screening, and research projects, this class explores the impact of digital media on art, design and daily living.
DIGM 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 451.courseDesc: Through class presentations, field trips, discussions, readings, screenings and guest speakers; this class bridges artistic and technical aspects of new media in theory and practice.
DIGM 451.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DIGM 475.fullName: Seminar: The Future of Digital Media
DIGM 475.courseDesc: Focuses on current and anticipated issues in digital media. Involves reading and discussion of news, product announcements, articles, and predictions related to digital media. Provides a comprehensive and up-to-date understanding of digital media, including its likely directions in the immediate future and long-term possibilities.
DIGM 475.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DIGM 475.prereqs: IDM 371 [Min Grade D] (Can be taken Concurrently) or DIGM 451 [Min Grade D]

DIGM 490.courseDesc: In this course students produce professional-level media assets for a team based senior project in a simulated real-world production environment. It requires a project that demonstrates the integration of the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in the overall field as well as in one or more specializations. Students will refine their understanding of the production, delivery and presentation of quality digital media production through implementation of professional best practices, and practice and perfect written, oral, and visual presentation skills through the power of collaboration, teamwork and shared missions.
DIGM 490.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DIGM 490.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
DIGM 490.prereqs: (ANIM 378 [Min Grade D] or GMAP 377 [Min Grade D] or IDM 372 [Min Grade D] or VRIM 320 [Min Grade D]) and (DIGM 451 [Min Grade D] or DIGM 475 [Min Grade D])

DIGM 491.courseDesc: In this course Digital Media senior project teams will meet with an appointed advisor on the technical details of their specific project requirements.
DIGM 491.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DIGM 491.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits

DIGM I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
DIGM I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DIGM I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
